description:
The Linux kernel community is in mourning following the loss of Larry Finger, a longtime and prolific contributor to WiFi drivers. Finger, who began his contributions to the Linux kernel in 2005 and had over 1,500 kernel patches accepted into the mainline Linux kernel, passed away on 21 June 2024. The news of Finger’s passing... Read more »

The post Linux community mourns loss of WiFi driver expert appeared first on Developer Tech News.
title: Linux community mourns loss of WiFi driver expert
